original: Plants naturally capture carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and utilize hydrogen to convert it into storable fuels, such as hydrocarbons (including plant oils and terpenes) and polyalcohols (such as glycerol, sugars, and starches). In the context of the methanol economy, processes that generate free hydrogen aim to use it immediately to reduce carbon dioxide into methanol. This approach mirrors the natural processes of photosynthesis an
